channel.title: Projects on Dr Michael Noetel
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Dr Michael Noetel

item.title: INSPIRE
item.description: INSPIRE is about knowledge translation for university teaching. How do we take the best evidence on what works for teaching and learning so we can apply it in practice?

item.title: Effective Altruism
item.description: I am interested in questions that focus on impartially improving welfare. I am increasingly focused on research that is important, neglected, and tractable, with a long-term view of the future.

item.title: Systematic Reviews
item.description: Systematic reviews are the core of evidence-informed decision-making. I’ve developed expertise in all parts of conducting a range of systematic reviews, meta-analyses, and meta-reviews (a.k.a., overviews of reviews).

item.title: Knowledge Translation
item.description: I think there’s so much wisdom trapped in universities. Often, getting that knowledge out into practice can save lives.

item.title: Video and Multimedia
item.description: Multimedia is the lingua franca of modern education. I’ve published meta-analyses showing it’s a great way of teaching, especially at scale. Most of my knowledge translations projects have heavily leveraged video and multimedia. I have ‘full-stack’ video production skills from scripting, co-ordination, videography, graphics, and editing.

item.title: Teaching and Speaking
item.description: Knowledge, like happiness, is best when shared. I love teaching both inside and outside universities. I am a confident presenter and an awarded educator.

item.title: PhD Thesis
item.description: My thesis looked at the effects of mindfulness in sport and performance settings.
